CommentsDate: Reviewed in the United States May 9, 2020
CommentsContent: I need to preface this review by stating that I only bought this via Amazon since my local Target was out of stock in this product for weeks. It wasn’t available there, either).My story: I have ridiculously sensitive skin with rosacea. Any but the most gentle products will cause it to become a blotchy irritated mess. I’ve used Cera Ve since it first came out when my dermatologist told me about this new brand offering a moisturizing lotion receiving rave reviews. While I really like the moisturizing ability of Cera Ve, I did find it to have a strong chemical scent and it could irritate my rosacea-prone areas (upper cheeks and around the nose). However, I believe the formula was tweaked over time and relied on a regiment of using this cleanser and the moisturizing cream for years to great effect. Combined with lifestyle changes, laser treatments, and medication, my rosacea became less of a concern.However, the last few months have been a nightmare with my skin. Starting in February, I noticed increased irritation and redness. Then my skin started to flare up and get hot in ways I haven’t experienced in years. I examined every possible cause: change in sunscreens (my favorite Cotz sunscreen was discontinued, so I tried several replacements including Cera Ve’s new tinted SPF 30). I checked potential lifestyle changes, issues with medication, food, etc. I was getting neurotic and depressed as my skin was often uncomfortable, hurting even, and I didn’t know why. Was this my rosacea just getting worse?About a week ago, my rosacea flared on my cheeks in the worse way. I was taking all my medications, using ice packs, washing my face and trying different skin care products in order to find the root cause. A few days later, I decided to just wash my face with this cleanser and apply the moisturizing cream. A few hours later, my cheeks were again burning. I washed my face and didn’t apply anything in it. I felt better, but noticed the area around my nose felt so raw and sensitive.The next day I began my research. Cera Ve was bought by L’Oreal a few years ago which coincided with the big increase in products offered with many of them either inappropriate for sensitive skin (salicylic acid) or basically the same cream you get in the big tub repackaged in a smaller tube with an added ingredient or two. Worse, the product staples (this cleanser and the moisturizers) were reformulated in order to remove Parabens.Well, I can firmly say that between this cleanser, the moisturizer, and tinted SPF 30 (which has salicylic acid in it), my skin actually became burnt and greatly irritated.I bought Cetaphil cleanser and Vanicream moisturizer and, in a matter of days, my skin is doing much better. I literally have lines on my skin showing where the irritation is healing. If you’ve ever had a chemical peel, it’s the same feeling as it begins from the T-Zone and moves outward.I contacted Cera Ve with my displeasure in these formulation changes and have not heard back. I’ve noticed others with similar issues here and I don’t believe it’s a fake product issue. I believe Cera Ve has really lost their way and become a brand I cannot trust.
